alert.note: Alert for Deschutes National Forest - minus Sisters Ranger District (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 15 at 2:04PM PDT until August 15 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...ISOLATED TO WIDELY SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS OVER SOUTH CENTRAL OREGON THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING... ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY... .Isolated to widely scattered thunderstorms will develop over south central Oregon this afternoon and evening. These storms will be capable of producing abundant lightning and will travel as far north as the southern Deschutes National Forest. On Thursday, winds will increase for areas in and around the Lower Columbia Basin. On Friday, a cold front will sweep across Washington and northern Oregon for even stronger winds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE OR611... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 611 Deschutes National Forest -minus Sisters Ranger District. * IMPACTS...New fire starts from lightning. Very dry and unstable conditions could result in extreme fire behavior. * THUNDERSTORMS...Isolated to widely scattered thunderstorms over south central Oregon may travel as far north as northern Klamath and southern Deschutes Counties. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Storms will be weak but are capable of gusty and erratic winds.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Deschutes National Forest - minus Sisters Ranger District
